@nlrexx1 I see it as them being extremely honest, not only with that but in the lyrics as well, they're straight up telling them what they're doing (Soda Pop was like that too but a lot more subtle given how upbeat and happy it sounded, Your Idol is a lot more in your face about it) they don't have to hide anymore, partly because of them all being hypnotized but even if they weren't, what would they think? makeup, special affects, a darker/edgier look and sound. very few of them would think anything of it, at most there might be a few audience members who preferred their Soda Pop era, that's it. it honestly reminds me of those conspiracy theories about the plots of disaster and apocalypse movies telling the audience things that are actually going to happen, what they're planning. regardless if you subscribe to those theories or not, they are a bit outlandish, that's what it makes me think of. hidden in plain sight.

Romance was actually so cool during this performance, he's not my favorite but I kept being drawn to him and his eerie, uncanny moves. I see the snake vibes. I love it ngl I'd be in trouble lol

western.author: @eris.astraea
western.text: I was crying when I first heard this song in the movie and now I'm teary again. This song just resonates with me. Its a reminder that we maybe broken, imperfect, and all but that doesn't mean we are of anything less. Find the beauty in our imperfections.

western.author: @sbush476
western.text: This song should be used in rehabilitation. This is the voice of so many struggling with addiction.

western.author: @Stormi-Bunni
western.text: Zoey's line "Why did I cover up the colors stuck inside my head?" struck something in me. Usually, I can't do what I actually want to do (draw, learn Korean, etc...) because it's seen as strange in my culture. I constantly get told that what I'm doing is wrong and that it shouldn't be done. The colors in my head, to me, relate to creativity. I can't be creative about the things that I want to do - because I can't do it. Like a year ago, I started not to care about what people would think and began to draw, write, sing, and so many other things, and it feels amazing to let everything out

western.text:
And to explain Dissociation identity mainly the line "I broke into a million pieces, and I can't go back.
But now I'm seeing all the beauty in the broken glass" as the main D.I.D symptom is the person breaking into pieces/parts. With a helpful tip for systems is to accept all their parts as equality valid even if they're not flawless.

A huge heart and a big hug to you

western.author: @ssnxmww
western.text:
lyrics:

Verse 1: Rumi]
Nothing but the truth now
Nothing but the proof of what I am
The worst of what I came from, patterns I'm ashamed of
Things that even I don't understand
I tried to fix it, I tried to fight it
My head was twisted, my heart divided
My lies all collided
I don't know why I didn't trust you to be on my side

[Chorus: Rumi, Zoey, Mira, All]
I broke into a million pieces, and I can't go back
But now I'm seeing all the beauty in the broken glass
The scars are part of me, darkness and harmony
My voice without the lies, this is what it sounds like
Why did I cover up the colors stuck inside my head?
I should've let the jagged edges meet the light instead
Show me what's underneath, I'll find your harmony
The song we couldn't write, this is what it sounds like

[Verse 2: Rumi]
We're shattering the silence, we're rising, defiant
Shouting in the quiet, "You're not alone"
We listened to the demons, we let them get between us
But none of us are out here on our own
So we were cowards, so we were liars
So we're not heroes, we're still survivors
The dreamers, the fighters, no lying, I'm tired
But dive in the fire, and I'll be right here by your side

[Chorus: Rumi]
We broke into a million pieces, and we can't go back
But now we're seeing all the beauty in the broken glass
The scars are part of me, darkness and harmony
My voice without the lies, this is what it sounds like
Why did we cover up the colors stuck inside our head?
Get up and let the jagged edges meet the light instead
Show me what's underneath, I'll find your harmony
Fearless and undefined, this is what it sounds like

[Bridge: All]
(Oh, hey) This is what it sounds like
(Oh, oh, oh) Hey, hey
This is what it sounds like
(Oh, oh, oh) Hey, hey
This is what it sounds like
(Oh, oh, oh) Hey, hey
Oh, this is what itâ€”, this is what itâ€”
This is what it sounds like
[Chorus: Rumi]
We broke into a million pieces, and we can't go back
But now I'm seeing all the beauty in the broken glass
The scars are part of me, darkness and harmony
My voice without the lies, this is what it sounds like
Why did we cover up the colors stuck inside our head?
Get up and let the jagged edges meet the light instead
Show me what's underneath, I'll find your harmony
Fearless and undefined, this is what it sounds like

[Outro: Rumi]
My voice without the lies, this is what it sounds like
Fearless and undefined, this is what it sounds like
Truth after all this time, our voices all combined
When darkness meets the light, this is what it sounds like

The chants may sound annoying for other teams but it boost the morale of the members to keep optimist.
